title: Understanding Scatter Plots
text: A scatter plot represents the relationship between two variables. Look at the points on the plot and think about whether they form a straight line or if they're scattered in a different pattern.

title: Identify the Pattern
text: Focus on the points to see if they create a recognizable pattern. Do they align in a straight path, curve, or show no specific formation?

title: Analyzing the Point Coordinates
text: Let's try and plot these points to visualize them better! For example, the first point is $$(1,1)$$ and the next is $$(3,9)$$. What does this tell us about their relationship?

title: Connect the Dots!
text: Now that you have plotted some points, try connecting them with lines. Are they making a straight line or a different pattern? What does that tell you about their relationship?

title: Final Decision - Linear or Not?
text: Having plotted and tried connecting the dots, would you say that the data points align to suggest a linear relationship? Recall what a linear pattern looks like!

title: Reflection
text: Reflect on what made you decide if the relationship is linear or not. Was it based on the plot, the shape formed, or other algebraic observations?
